intro: Sticherus retroflexus, commonly known as the red-stemmed starwort, is a small, herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats and knotweeds. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are ovate to lanceolate, with a distinctive reddish or purple coloration on the underside. The flowers are small and clustered in dense, star-like inflorescences, which are characteristic of the genus Sticherus.
